summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and Department of Justice (ODAG) personnel discussing coordination for a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on updating the victim list for the meeting, which is a requirement from the settlement in the CVRA litigation, and clarifying roles between the USAO, ODAG, and FBI victim services.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the email sender had previously spoken to about the victim meeting.

persons.name: Bekah
persons.context: Has been in touch with ODAG's Stacie to coordinate the victim meeting and share lessons from previous meetings.

persons.name: Stacie
persons.context: The ODAG contact coordinating the victim meeting; the USAO has suggested she reach out to FBI victim services.

persons.name: Wendy
persons.context: An FBI victim services coordinator whom ODAG was suggested to contact for an updated victim list.

persons.name: John
persons.context: A supervisor whom the email sender could raise the issue of FBI attendance at the victim meeting with.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: A supervisor whom the email sender could raise the issue of FBI attendance at the victim meeting with.

connections.description: Have been in touch to coordinate the victim meeting and share lessons from previous USAO victim meetings.
Collaborating to organize a victim meeting as required by the CVRA litigation settlement, with ODAG leading and USAO providing support and information.
The USAO is relying on the FBI, particularly victim services, to provide the most updated list of victim contact information.

events.title: Planned ODAG Victim Meeting
events.description: The Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) is planning a meeting with Epstein victims in Washington, D.C., to explain and review the findings of OPR's investigation, as required by the Department's settlement in the CVRA litigation.

events.title: Nolle Proceeding
events.description: A proceeding related to the non-prosecution or dismissal of charges (nolle prosequi) involving Epstein, after which the USAO sent a list of victims to ODAG.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Department of Justice (ODAG) was organizing a victim meeting in late 2020 as a requirement of the settlement in the CVRA (Crime Victims' Rights Act) litigation related to Jeffrey Epstein.

There was an effort to compile a comprehensive and updated list of victims, acknowledging that the FBI victim services would have a larger list than the one generated in August 2019, including victims identified since then and from various jurisdictions.

The meeting's purpose was to present the findings of an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) investigation, and organizers were taking steps to minimize substantive discussions of victims' experiences during the main meeting.
The email chain reveals inter-agency coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY), ODAG, and the FBI regarding victim outreach and communication.
